title: Which season do you think was the most balanced and fun to play in?
body:
Just out of curiosity i want to see what people think. 
Please Upvote the post! {{sticker:poppy-wink}}

Season 5. That season, you could have an entire team of feeders and still have a chance to win. Today, a single feeder = gg.

I loved season 2 and 3, while in the old days, and seasons beyond it was still the same, only select few champs were meta, but back then, anyone that wasn't meta was straight bad to play as.
Also back then, most champions actually had different power curves, except for assassins, who were strong all game unless they got counter picked, and then they wouldn't be able to do shit all game. Feast or Famine. I liked it when there was actually such a thing as, lane bullies, hyper carries, the trinity of burst > dps > tank > burst.

Since season 6, everyone's power curve feels too similar, but unpopular opinion, this season is starting to change for the better again. While we still have meta champs, this season has probably been the most champions that can be picked that won't lead to feast or famine situations. Champions start to feel like they have their own unique power curves again with some exceptions, which are the current meta adcs.
While lane bullies still don't really exist anymore, I'm starting to feel those champs that are actually weak early again, and scale to late, or people who are strong early, and fall off late. It's a step forward to making the game enjoyable again
